description.narrative: The overall goal is the reduction of illiteracy in Kenia Malawi and Tanzania through literacy classes in nine minority languages for women (open to men also). The plan is based on a pilot project begun by the Bible Socities (BS) in 2015 for 4 minority grou ps. To date primer materials have been developed and BS staff and teachers have been trained in three language groups. The programme (LWA) has been partly supported by the Australian and British Bible Societies. The United Bible Societies are strategically committed LWA. BSs are well respected and accepted locally.Each group's unique language features and culture are the starting point for language analysis. Before expanding the programme to other language groups similar situational analasyes will be done m aking use of previously learned data and experiences. Joint training mentoring and exchange of experiences will be utilised across countries and languages groups to facilitate the whole programme.Target group are non-literate women who are double-marginali zed: due gender and mother tongue. The goal is that by 2022 15000 women will have learned to read. The literacy classes take the learner through the basics and progresses to reading using familiar cultural themes. Futher reading materials are then devised on relevant topics enabling the learners to learn new skills thought literacy. On the basis of gender analysis the suplementary reading materials broach also questions of inequality in the language groups. Materials produced with MFA funds do not contain religious material. The second goal of the LWA is to increase the capacity of the Kenian Malawian and Tanzanian Bible Societies in Literacy. The staff will be trained and mentored to the level that they can independently implement comprehensive literacy a ctivities for minority language groups after 2022.The third goal is to increase the capacity of the Bible Soctieties' staff and the SIL consultants' in gender through training. This ables gendermainstreaming in the program.SIL Int'l is responsible for prov iding the consultant services for the LWA and for ensuring the quality of the materials produced.
